concept.title: Property
concept.shortdesc: Also known as a Custom Traffic Variable, Custom Insight Variable, or property variable (prop). Props are sub-groups or subsections of channels. For example, assume a web site has two channels: News and Weather. The News channel can have the following four sub-groups, or properties: National, Local, Sports, and Politics.

conbody.p: In the interface, the menus call the reports Custom Traffic reports. These reports are based on traffic variables that behave the same as the predefined variables like pageName, channel, and server.
See Traffic Variables in Admin Tools Help.

Each s.prop populates a custom traffic report, is case sensitive, limited to 100 bytes, and there are up to 75 available (s.prop1 through s.prop75). Props are used within an implementation to populate custom traffic reports. Unlike eVars, props do not persist beyond the image request. Instead, their main purpose is to determine the amount of traffic a certain dimension of your site received.
See propN in the Implementation Guide.
